message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as a primary or secondary school teacher from Croatia. I need to respond to 10 statements using one of the response options: "Strongly disagree", "Disagree", "Agree", "Strongly agree", or "I don't know".

Let me think about each statement from the perspective of a teacher who would have a balanced, realistic view of AI in education:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - AGREE (AI can assist with brainstorming and improving lesson plan structure)

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - AGREE (AI can help personalize learning materials)

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AGREE (AI tools can help provide individualized feedback and support)

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs (multilingual learners, students with special education needs) - AGREE (AI has clear potential for accessibility and support)

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - STRONGLY AGREE (This is clearly a practical use case)

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - AGREE (This is a real risk/concern with AI tools like ChatGPT)

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AGREE (AI can make errors and inappropriate suggestions)

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - AGREE (AI can perpetuate biases present in training data)

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - AGREE (Data privacy is a legitimate concern with AI systems)

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students - AGREE (AI might suggest approaches that aren't pedagogically sound)

Now I need to format these responses in the required JSON structure for the function call.
